intro: Heterolaena alpestris, commonly known as the alpine heterolaena, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences and lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool, dry conditions. Its flowers are usually pink or red, and it produces small, dry fruits that disperse its seeds. Heterolaena alpestris is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
